channel.title: Articles on CSE
channel.description: Recent content in Articles on CSE

item.title: GameJam
item.description: GameJam The winners of the 2019 Spring Gamejam. Click to play their game! The TU CSE GameJam is a game jam series hosted every semester by the CSE Department and Dr. Jon Denning and run by students at Taylor University. A game jam is a short, fun, and intense party during which students get together to develop a video game from scratch. Regardless of major or knowledge of programming, all TU students are invited to participate!

item.title: Systems Option
item.description: What is Systems? Systems is not a minor in Computer Science. The goal of the Systems curriculum is to help students recognize that the world is filled with systems (like educational, distribution, and manufacturing systems). It is the processes inhabiting these systems that produce value and help organizations achieve high performance. Our graduates are enjoying careers at enterprises of all sizes, including global consulting companies.   What in the world is Accenture selling?

item.title: Abet Accreditation
item.description: Our Engineering & Computer Engineering programs are ABET-accredited. Accreditation The Engineering & Computer Engineering degree programs are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET (https://www.abet.org). Program Educational Objectives Prepare our graduates to server others dependably, most importantly their employer, customers, and community. Prepare our graduates to practice technical competence, producing reliable engineering designs. Prepare our graduates to exercise creativity in their work, fostering innovative solutions.

item.title: About Us
item.description: Sometimes alumni Ashley Crutcher designs websites that convince people to buy products, like guacamole. But sometimes her goal is more serious, like convincing people to follow Jesus. At Taylor University, the Computer Science & Engineering (CSE) department is more than just a section of the science building. We have our own community on the second floor of the environmentally sustainable Euler Science Complex that flourishes as a learning environment.
